key_insight: Use the text prompt (object description) to score and prune irrelevant visual tokens before temporal reasoning, so SAM2 only processes a compact, task-relevant token set â€” drastically cutting compute and memory with minimal accuracy loss.
problem_solved: SAM2 processes dense visual tokens across time for prompt-driven video/object segmentation, causing high compute and memory costs and poor scalability; the paper reduces wasted computation by removing tokens that are not relevant to the text-guided target.
method: Text-driven token scoring: compute relevance scores for image tokens conditioned on the text prompt (target description).
Token pruning before temporal modules: keep top-K or thresholded high-scoring tokens and discard low-relevance tokens from propagation across frames.
Lightweight integration with SAM2 temporal pipeline to preserve segmentation quality while reducing FLOPs and memory footprint.
impact: Makes SAM2-style promptable video/object segmentation significantly faster and more memory-efficient, enabling practical deployment (real-time, multi-object, or edge devices) with little accuracy tradeoff.
visual_elements: Before/After pipeline diagram: full-token propagation vs. text-driven token pruning with fewer tokens passed to temporal modules.
Token relevance visualization: image overlay showing retained vs. pruned tokens colored by text-driven scores.
Bar chart: compute (FLOPs), memory, and latency reductions vs. baseline SAM2 alongside small accuracy drop.
Tradeoff curve: accuracy vs. token budget (top-K) to show sweet spot for practitioners.
paper_title: Fast SAM2 with Text-Driven Token Pruning
paper_authors: Avilasha Mandal, Chaoning Zhang, Fachrina Dewi Puspitasari, Xudong Wang, Jiaquan Zhang
